cs.DS, cs.GT, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.SI. 

The paper deals with a matching problem, which is a classic topic in computer science and falls under the category of algorithms and data structures (cs.DS). The problem involves preferences and constraints, which are modeled using graph theory and combinatorial optimization techniques, making it relevant to the subfield of game theory (cs.GT). The paper also proposes a polyhedral approach to solve the problem, which involves linear programming and optimization, making it relevant to the subfield of artificial intelligence (cs.AI) and machine learning (cs.LG). Finally, the paper discusses the application of the problem to academic hiring, which falls under the subfield of social and information networks (cs.SI).
